content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Refers to the classical problem of splitting Strings and reversing Lists. really quick if you know how to do it, and definitively good to learn tricks otherwise :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Somewhat simple depending on your approach but fun. It can be solved in many different ways without much language bias.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: After formatting and adding more info, and changing it from reverse mode,
This is an interesting challenge for fastest and shortest, but imo not fit for reverse.

Relatively simple but not necessarily a bad thing.
New and unique challenge, well done :)

Nice. Some major improvements.

1. It's not obvious to me why the input is related to hexadecimal? There is never an input using containing any a, b, c, d, e or f. 
Why do the inputs contain only digits? It could be any text.
So why starting the input with 0x?

2. The input section s:string and t:string is not according the guide lines.

3. Without changing the program at all, I would find it even more tricky to change the test cases to:
input: ABCDEFGHIJ
Output: IJ GH EF CD

Input:    HOE!AMNGDICO
Output: CO DI NG AM E!

Input:    HIARTWNOVELOKEMA
Output: MA KE LO VE NO TW AR

Input:    TUARTWNOVELOKEMA
Output: MA KE LO VE NO TW AR

My solution:
a=input()
print(' '.join(a[i:i+2] for i in range(len(a)-2,1,-2)))
it's little endian presentation in intel processors

Hi, I have fixed formatting and made it more obvious what to do.
I also personally don't believe this is fit for reverse, as it was not obvious what was going on until I read the above comments.
